page.title: Castle of the Pomeranian Dukes in Darłowo

revision.text:
{{Infobox historic site | name = Castle of the Pomeranian Dukes | image = Darlowo3.jpg | image_size = 300 | caption = Castle of the Pomeranian Dukes | locmapin = Poland | map_width = 275 | map_caption = Location of the Castle of the Pomeranian Dukes in Poland | lat_degrees = 54 | lat_minutes = 25 | lat_seconds = 11 | lat_direction = N | long_degrees = 16 | long_minutes = 24 | long_seconds = 43 | long_direction = E | coord_display = inline, title | coord_parameters = type:landmark_scale:3000_region:PL | location = [[Darłowo]], [[West Pomeranian Voivodeship]] in [[Poland]] | area = | built = 1352 | demolished = | rebuilt = 1449-1459 | architect = | architecture = [[Gothic architecture|Gothic]] | governing_body = | designation1 = | designation1_offname = | designation1_date = | designation1_type = | designation1_number = | designation1_free1name = | designation1_free1value = | designation1_free2name = | designation1_free2value = | designation2 = | designation3 = | visitation_num = | visitation_year = | visitation_ref = | height = }}
'''Castle of the Pomeranian Dukes''' - the only [[Gothic architecture|Gothic]] castle located on the coast of the [[Baltic Sea]] in [[Poland]]. The castle's formation is close to that of a [[square]], with a tower measuring 24 metres in height. The castle's construction began in 1352, in the reign of [[Bogislaw V, Duke of Pomerania|Bogusław V]], who's reign began the alliance with the [[Hanseatic League]]. In the eighteenth and nineteenth centuries the castle was used as a warehouse and a prison. Since 1930, the castle was turned into a museum.<ref>{{cite web|title=Spis Zabytków|url=http://www.nid.pl/pl/Informacje_ogolne/Zabytki_w_Polsce/rejestr-zabytkow/zestawienia-zabytkow-nieruchomych/stan%20na%2030.09.13/ZPO-rej.pdf|website=NID|accessdate=2 May 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Museum Main Page|url=http://www.zamekdarlowo.pl/|website=Zamek Darłowo|accessdate=2 May 2015}}</ref>
==History==
[[File:Zamek Książąt Pomorskich w Darłowie-dziedziniec.jpg|thumb|left|250px|View on the courtyard in the Castle of the Pomeranian Dukes]] The Castle of the Pomeranian Dukes, built in the second half of the fourteenth century; in 1352. The castle was built during the reign of [[Bogislaw V, Duke of Pomerania|Bogusław V]] and Elżbieta - daughter of [[Casimir III the Great]]. Although this was only a secondary residence of the [[House of Pomerania]], the castle was enlarged and modernised in the fifteenth and sixteenth century, becoming a worth royal residence. The town of [[Darłowo]] was given the title of ''The Royal City of Darłowo'' (''Królewskie Miasto Darłowo'', [[Polish language|Polish]])
The greatest expansion of the castle was done under the reign of [[Eric of Pomerania]], who rebuilt the castle to that of the design of his previous residence, [[Kronborg|Kronborg Castle]]. He had also modernised the castle's defensive fortifications, and built a second defence line, in the form of dikes around the castle. The following expansion of the castle was done under the reign of Duke [[Bogislaw X, Duke of Pomerania|Bogusław X]]. When a new wing was built. The next changes were done by Duke [[Barnim XI, Duke of Pomerania|Barnim XI]]. After a great fire, which devastated the castle in 1624, the last Duke of the [[House of Pomerania]], [[Bogislaw XIV, Duke of Pomerania|Bogusław XIV]], had rebuilt the castle. However, he did not restore the castle to its original architectural style. The castle had lost many of its defences, and a chapel was built inside the Duke Hall. After the duke's death, his widow, Duchess Elżbieta, took over the castle, who lived with him until death.<ref>{{cite web|title=Zamek Darłowo|url=http://zamki.res.pl/darlowo.htm|website=Zamki|accessdate=2 May 2015}}</ref>
